title: A case study of user interface management system development and application
proctitle: CHI '89: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
abstract: This paper discusses the design and applications of an object-oriented user interface management system (UIMS). Specifically, the Lockheed User Interface System (LUIS) is described. LUIS is based on a user interface model that includes declarative and procedural components. The package has been used by both non-programmers and programmers in several applications at Lockheed. Experiences derived from applications of the package are used to address several key issues in the UIMS field, such as procedural versus declarative specification, separation of the user interface from applications, UIMS flexibility, and UIMS support for design evaluation.

references.text: Buxton, W., Lamb, M.R., Sherman, D., and Smith, K.C. Towards a Comprehensive User Interface Management System. Computer Graphics, 17, 3, 1983, pp 35-42.
Green, M. Report on Dialogue Specification Tools. In Pfaff G. (ed) User Interface Management Systems, Springer Verlag, Berlin, 1985.

Hayes, P. J., Szekely, P.A., and Lerner, R.A. Design Alternatives for User Interface Management Systems Based on Experience with COUSIN. Proceedings of the Conference on Human Factors in Computer Systems, San Francisco, Ca., April, 1985, pp. 169-175.
Lowgren. J. History, State, and Future of User Interface Management Systems. SIGCHI Bulletin, 20, 1, 1988, pp 32-44.

Rosenberg, J., Hill R., Miller, J., Schulert, A., Schewmake, D. UIMSs: Threat or Menace? Panel Discussion in Proceedings of the CHI'88 Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems, Washington D.C., May, 1988, pp. 197-200.
Schulert, A.J., Rogers, G.T., and Hamilton, J.A. ADM - A Dialog Manager. Proceedings of the Conference on Human Factors in Computer Systems, San Francisco, Ca., April, 1985, pp. 177-183.
